meanings.definition: A printing process in which individual sheets of paper are fed into a printing press.
meanings.sent1: The sheetfed process allows for precise printing on individual sheets of paper.
meanings.sent2: The printer used a sheetfed technique to produce flyers for the event.
meanings.sent3: I tried to sheetfed my homework into the printer, but it got jammed!
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a sheetfed printer, processing one sheet of information at a time.
meanings.sent5: The sheetfed method ensures each paper receives equal attention during printing.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a printing press that uses individual sheets of paper rather than a continuous roll.
meanings.sent1: The sheetfed printer was more suitable for small-scale projects.
meanings.sent2: The sheetfed technology revolutionized the printing industry.
meanings.sent3: The sheetfed press felt lonely without a continuous roll to work with.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity flowed in a sheetfed manner, focusing on one idea at a time.
meanings.sent5: The sheetfed design process allowed for greater flexibility in printing options.
